text:
Steve Irwin's son Robert is following in his dad's footsteps and people can't get enough of it The 13-year-old son of the legendary nature expert introduced Jimmy Fallon to his wild friends Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Steve Irwin's son is following in his father's footsteps Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Steve Irwin's son Robert is following in his father's footsteps and has everyone's attention at just 13 years old. 
The teenage son of the late Crocodile Hunter star made an appearance on the Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon this week and was happy to talk about his famous dad and continuing his legacy. 
He excitedly gave the TV host some facts about an animal in a childhood photo, leading Jimmy to quip: "This is so cool - you're actually your dad." Robert Irwin followed in his dad's footsteps on Jimmy Fallon (Photo: NBCUniversal) The 13-year-old was SO enthusiastic (Photo: NBCUniversal) He's continuing his dad's legacy (Photo: NBCUniversal) 
Robert replied: "My dad was actually on the Tonight Show quite a while ago. So, it's really nice to be able to follow in his foosteps. It's really great." Read More 
It's no surprise the boy is as enthusiastic about the natural world and the creatures that inhabit it - with mum Terri and older sister Bindi also continuing Steve's great work following his tragic death in 2006. Look familiar? (Photo: Splash) Steve would be proud 
"Itâ€™s just in my blood," he explained. "I actually grew at Australia Zoo, so I think I'm the luckiest kid on planet earth." Read More 
Not surprisingly, viewers instantly fell in love with Robert and his contagious excitement for wildlife. Jimmy loved having Robert - and his pals - on the show (Photo: NBCUniversal) The Irwin family Bindi, Steve, Robert and Terri (Photo: ITV) 
"I want to be Robert Irwin when I grow up," joked one user on Twitter. 
Another tweeted: "When does Robert Irwin get his show?! #crocodilehunter" 
A different fan wrote: "OMG I'm crying. Robert Irwin is mini-Steve. The apple doesn't fall far from the tree! What a gorgeous kid." Like us on Facebook
